Chapler 1 Encounter with Mysterious Creatures [[My]0-i friends]224-my friends . It ’s quite a long time since [we]225-we saw [one another]226-one another ; let [us]225-we involve [ourselves]225-we in some dialogues . [I]0-i have something to tell [you]222-you ; for [I]0-i recall today what happened to [me]0-i in those days as if they occurred yesterday . [I]0-i remember the days when [I]0-i was very young , that [I]0-i was following [[my]0-i father]227-my father to [[our]225-we farm]228-our farm - [[our]225-we remote farm]229-our remote farm . [[My]0-i father]227-my father enrolled [me]0-i in [the school]231-the school when [I]0-i was young but whenever [we]225-we were on holiday^ [I]0-i would go to [the farm]232-the farm . The period was very remarkable in [my]0-i life because it was full of enjoyment . The story [I]0-i would tell [you]233-you today is about [a man [I]0-i came across during the period]234-a man i came across during the period - the sqason of enjoyment jn [[our]225-we farmstead]235-our farmstead . [We]225-we would throw a lot of fresh maize cobs into the fire stand and start dispossessing- the cobs of [their]236-their grains . If [we]225-we ate fresh maize in the afternoon , [we]225-we would consume pounded yam in the evening . The heavy wrapped pounded yam with plantain leaves usually makes [our]225-we stomach look like a sack of palm kernel . [I]0-i also remember vividly that [our]225-we trap caught various animals . [We]225-we came across snails , and mushrooms grew sporadically on^ [the farms.\]237-the farms.\ [A big river]238-a big river was flowing beside [[[my]0-i father]227-my father ’s farm]240-my father ’s farm ; [I]0-i always fish in it . [I]0-i had no net but [I]0-i made use of line and hook . Whenever [I]0-i made a journey to [the river]241-the river with [my]0-i line and hook , [I]0-i would be . as happy as if [I]0-i was in [paradise]242-paradise . IREKE ONIBUDO0

[[My]0-i father]227-my father helped [me]0-i a lot because [he]227-my father knew [my]0-i weaknesses . Whenever [we]225-we went to [the farm]232-the farm in the morning and [I]0-i got hold of [my]0-i hoe weeding , [he]227-my father would be observing [me]0-i . If [I]0-i started resting , standing and placing [my]0-i arms on [my]0-i waist as a result of pain , [he]227-my father would tell [me]0-i to go and stay under the shady tree ' and rest . Whenever the sun was manifesting its hostility and the noon was fast approaching , [he]227-my father would tell [me]227-my father to go to [[our]225-we hut]2399-our hut . Freedom would be given to [me]227-my father in the evening to go on a fishing expedition . [God]44-god made [farmers kings]2400-farmers kings on [[their]2400-farmers kings farms]2401-their farms . Most of the things that are valued by [people living in [the town]2403-the town]2402-people living in the town are valueless to [them]2400-farmers kings . Firewood is of no impbrtance to [them]2400-farmers kings ; leaves are without honour ; foodstuffs are too much . [A man ignorant of the power of God]2404-a man ignorant of the power of god should go and observe the various unique things on [the farm]232-the farm . There are tall trees as well as short ones ; there are big birds , as well as small ones . [Snakes]61-snakes are running around while snails are quietly gliding about ; spiders are making webs while termites are creating motinds . Some birds live in trees ; some inhabit burrowed holes ; while others reside in [nests]2406-nests . Bats swing [their]2407-their heads downward to sleep ; owls hoot - about in the night ; doves announce the different times of the day to [the farmers]2408-the farmers as the natural clock of [the forest]2409-the forest . [The farmers]2408-the farmers wash down [their]2408-the farmers meals with cold water . Doubtlessly , [you]2411-you would know the proverb of [the elders]2412-the elders that “ How many are countable among the teeth of ‘[227-my father] [Adepele]62-adepele ’ ; within is hundred , without is hundred and sixty ; yet , four hundred and forty premolars are buried within . ” [I]227-my father think [I]227-my father have now said enough about [the farmers]2408-the farmers . [I]227-my father should continue with thfe story . It happened that when [we]245-we had midyear holidays , [I]227-my father dressed up and went to [the farm]232-the farm in the company of [[my]227-my father immediate younger [IREKE ONIBUDO]59-ireke onibudo[227-my father]

sister]2415-my immediate younger ireke onibudo sister , [Mary]63-mary . As [we]245-we were going , [we]245-we got to the bank of [a big river]238-a big river that * was on the way to [[our]245-we farm]228-our farm . [We]245-we observed that it was too full because it was a rainy season . 0n seeing this , [I]0-i told [[my]0-i younger sister]248-my younger sister to return [home]249-home while 1 entered [the river]241-the river and swam across . After some trekking , * ! saw [a short man whose height terminated at [my]0-i waist despite [my]0-i short height at that time]251-a short man whose height terminated at my waist despite my short height at that time . [He]251-a short man whose height terminated at my waist despite my short height at that time was going at [my]0-i front while [I]0-i was behind . [He]251-a short man whose height terminated at my waist despite my short height at that time later stopped and [I]0-i also did because [I]0-i was^fiightened . [J]56-onibudo had never seen [a man as short as that]252-a man as short as that before . [No other person]253-no other person except [the two of [us]254-the two of us]254-the two of us was in [the vicinity]255-the vicinity . [I]0-i waited quietly in anticipation of [his]251-a short man whose height terminated at my waist despite my short height at that time reaction . [I]0-i later lost sight of [the man]256-the man . [I]0-i then continued [my]0-i journey . * After walking for a moment , [I]0-i looked back and saw [the man behind [me]0-i]257-the man behind me . That was the moment [I]0-i discovered that [he]256-the man had only one eye . The eye was on [his]256-the man forehead . It resembled the pocketable mirror that [ladies]258-ladies put in [their]258-ladies handbags . [I]0-i tried to talk but [my]0-i tongue failed [me]0-i ; [I]0-i became dumb . [I]0-i then took to [my]0-i heels . On looking back , [I]0-i saw [seven dwarfs]259-seven dwarfs pursuing [me]0-i . [They]259-seven dwarfs quickly caught up with [me]0-i despite the high velocity of [my]0-i speed and started dragging [me]0-i into the bush . After [they]259-seven dwarfs had dragged [me]0-i in the bush for about five minutes , [I]0-i lost [their]259-seven dwarfs sight . In [their]259-seven dwarfs stead was [a man that stood before [me]0-i]260-a man that stood before me . [I]0-i also saw [a man in rags by [my]0-i right - hand side]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side . The one before [me]0-i -vyas so handsome ; [I]0-i never saw [anyone as attractive]262-anyone as attractive . [He]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side wore an immaculate white cloth ; [he]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side put on a golden'cap and wore a pair of golden ' shoes ; [his]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side face was as smooth as a mirror ; [his]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side teeth were as Mite as the face of the sun ; [his]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side body was like a young sprouting plant on [the river bank]2416-the river bank manifesting the glory of [God]44-god . The white cloth worn by [him]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side reached both [his]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side ankles and wrists . [Hd]64-hd looked unrivalled because [he]261-a man in rags by my right - hand side did not look like [an ordinary human being]2417-an ordinary human being . [IREKE ONIBUDO]59-ireke onibudo[261-a man in rags by my right - hand side]

[He]263-he smiled on'seeing [me]0-i and touched [my]0-i head with [his]263-he staff ; As [he]263-he did that , [I]0-i regained [my]0-i confidence and became relieved of [my]0-i fright . [He]263-he said , “ [[You]0-i young child]264-you young child , [I]0-i congratulate [you.on]265-you.on the plan [God]44-god has iir [His]44-god heart to use [you]0-i for the development of [human beings]266-human beings . Truly , [you]0-i are [a young child]267-a young child butdt is the egg that transforms into a cock . The youthful stage of [a man]268-a man reflects [his]268-a man future . The root is the most important part of a tree . [[A river]269-a river ’s source]270-a river ’s source is its coordinator . Start bgilding [[your]0-i house]271-your house on [the rock]272-the rock now because [God]44-god is the rock ; all other things are sand . Put [your]0-i life in the hands of [God]44-god . [You]0-i should not forget that humaabeings are dangerous because [they]273-they disrespect truth and feed on deceit like pieces of meat . [[Your]0-i creator]274-your creator wants [you]0-i to be speaking the truth . Though , [people]275-people love [liars]276-liars but the love is for a while . [People]275-people also create downfall for [liars]276-liars . [A truthful man]279-a truthful man does not come apross honour easily and quickly but when [he]279-a truthful man gets hold of it , [he]279-a truthful man sits down like [a king]280-a king , stands confidently and walks about like [a brave and powerful man]281-a brave and powerful man . Why ? Because [he]279-a truthful man did not accompany [other men]282-other men in covertly acts . [He]279-a truthful man neven*partook in treachery ; [he]279-a truthful man apportioned blames to [guilty men]283-guilty men ; , [he]279-a truthful man judged [a righteous man]284-a righteous man accordingly because [he]284-a righteous man received bribe from [nobody]285-nobody . [He]284-a righteous man did not involve [himself]284-a righteous man in a partial judgment . However strong the rope of deceit is , a righteous nian.cuts it with a worn - out knife , “ Perseverance is very important . Oljserve [[your]286-you surrounding trees]287-your surrounding trees . [They]287-your surrounding trees are different from ’ one . another ; they are taller than one another . [You]286-you should observe also that [those dwarfs that brought [you]286-you to [me]287-your surrounding trees]2418-those dwarfs that brought you to me are shorter than [me]287-your surrounding trees . Look at [this man]2419-this man qt [your]286-you right - hand side and [you]286-you would see that [his]2419-this man rags - are different from the gorgeous attire on nie . Creatures of [the world]2420-the world are not similar . In the same way , the lives of [men]2421-men are different . [A man]268-a man can inherit [the world]2420-the world through perseverance . [One who perseveres]2424-one who perseveres would always be where [courageous men]2425-courageous men stand , but [a coward [IREKE ONIBUDO]59-ireke onibudo]2426-a coward ireke onibudo[287-your surrounding trees]

would be in - the midst of [commoners]288-commoners . Forever , [you]289-you should also [cherisb - respecting elders]290-cherisb - respecting elders . Please , [I]0-i beg [you]289-you passionately,- pride is a stain . Do not let it splash on [you]289-you . [Any man it splashes on]291-any man it splashes on is condemned . The sin 6f pride is like a notorious stumbling block put on [a man]268-a man ’s way by [the devil]293-the devil . [I]0-i am telling [you]289-you with all sincerity that the devil will eventually be destroyed . “ Oh the Day of Judgement , [the devil]293-the devil would be in interminable sorrow but [a righteous man]284-a righteous man ’s life would have been spoilt before [the land]296-the land consumes [the wicked]297-the wicked . So , do not allow [the devil]293-the devil to splash the stain of pride on [you]289-you . But gentleness is different from foolishness . [Your]289-you gentleness .should not be accompanied with foolishness . [A leader]299-a leader should not be doing what [a servant]300-a servant is supposed to do for [him]299-a leader to be regarded as being gentle . Likewise , [a man]268-a man should not in the name of gentleness turn [himself]268-a man to a dung hill used by [^11 men]302-^11 men . [A man that is'skeptical about [his]268-a man ability*to\io one thing or the other shouldjely onfrfvine - strength _ and talent]303-a man that is'skeptical about his ability*to\io one thing or the other shouldjely onfrfvine - strength _ and talent ; pride should be repudiated . [Skepticism]65-skepticism is [an arch antagonist of [man]305-man]304-an arch antagonist of man . Disallow it from conquering [you]289-you . “ [[You]289-you child]306-you child , observe [the person]307-the person standing at [your]289-you right - hand side . Look at [him]307-the person very well because [I]0-i will send [him]307-the person to [you]289-you in \ the future time when yeiuwould have grown from childhood to adulthood . [He]307-the person will come to [you]289-you to tell [you]289-you [his]307-the person life history . Face [your]289-you studies squarely in order to prepare for the coming days . For , a time will come when [[your]289-you father]308-your father .will close [his]308-your father eyes and refuse to open them ; and [he]308-your father will leave [his]308-your father responsibilities to [you]289-you . “ [I]0-i am now going . May [God]44-god male [your]289-you lifetime.good . Greet [your'father]309-your'father , [[your]289-you mother]310-your mother , [[your]289-you younger ones]311-your younger ones , ’ most especially [yOur immediate yovmger sister]2427-your immediate yovmger sister , [Mary]63-mary , that stands at the peak of [your]289-you heart . Goodbye . ” That was what [the man]256-the man told [me]312-me and handed [me]312-me over to [the IREKE ONIBUDO[312-me]

man in rag]2429-the ireke onibudo man in rag with the instruction that [he]312-me should take [me]0-i back to [the path]313-the path , which [he]312-me did . But it was when [I]0-i got to [the road]314-the road that 1 asked from [the man]256-the man how [he]256-the man got to where [I]0-i saw [him]256-the man , and [he]256-the man explained that [he]256-the man was taken to [.the place by [the same people that took [me]0-i there]317-the same people that took me there]316-.the place by the same people that took me there ... [She]1078-the woman kept it on the shelf , laid down but never thought [she]1078-the woman could sleep off . Hardly had [she]1078-the woman lied down than [she]1078-the woman slept off . [She]1078-the woman became [a leper]3303-a leper before dawn and [her]1078-the woman fingers started cutting off . That was how [she]1078-the woman ruined [her]1078-the woman own life . “ [I]0-i was also startled to discover that [the residents]1923-the residents were poor due to [their]1923-the residents inability to work . “ [We]1945-we didn ’ t react to [his]1321-the spirit utterances but prepared [ourselves]1945-we for the'battle ahead . [Kumofehinti]176-kumofehinti attacked [him]1321-the spirit first . [I]1955-you had never witnessed such a tough physical combat . [Kumofehinti]176-kumofehinti acted strongly and [the goblin]1105-the goblin reacted fiercely and stubbornly . ‘ Let [us]3600-us talk , about another thing . Let [us]3600-us talk about pride . What is pride?;Pride means placing [oneself]3601-oneself above [one]606-one ’s status . Either it is conceived in the heart , spoken or acted . It impedes [man]305-man ’s progress , creates downfall and ridicules . [Aproud person]3604-aproud person is always belittled by [people]275-people . Pride shows in [one]606-one ’s little behaviour . Let [us]3600-us talk about greetings . [Some young people]3607-some young people do n’t greet [the elderly people]3608-the elderly people respectfully nowadays .
